div.l: And about midnight went they to rest
Wele hath þis mylner v̉ernissht his hede
Ful pale he was for drunk ⁊and not rede
He yoxith and he spekith þurgh þe nose
As he were in the quak or in the pose
To bedde he goth and wᵗith him his wif
As any Iay was she light and iolif
So was his ioli whistil wele y wette
The cradil at hir beddis fete was sette
To rocke and to yeue the child souke
And whan̄ þat drunk was all þᵗat is in̄ þᵉ crouke
To bedde went the dought̉er right anon̄
To bedde goth aleyne and also Iohn̄
It nas no nede to yeue theym̄ duale
Þis mylner hath so wisly bibbid ale
Þat as an hors he fnortith in his slepe
And of his taile behynde he toke no kepe
His wif bare him a burdon̄ fulle strong
Men̄ might hir here route a furlong
The wench routith eke p̉er cumpanye
And aleyn̄ the clerc hath herd þis melody
He poukid Iohn and seid slepist thou
Herdist thou euer such a song or nowe
Lo such a coupling is betwix hem̄ alle
A wilde fire vpon̄ theire bodies falle
Who herd euer such a ferly thing
Ye they shul haue the floure of euel ending
For in this long nyght tite me no Rest
But yit no fors alle shal be for the best
For Iohn seid he as euer mote I thryue
If that I may the yong wench wil I swyue
Sum Esement hath lawe y shapen̄ vs
For Iohn ther͗e is a lawe that seith thus

l.hi: Þat if a man̄ be in one point agreued
Þat in anothir͗e he shal be Releued

div.l: Oure corn̄ is stolne sotheli it is no nay
And we han̄ hadde an euyll fytte to da
